title: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: I just purchased a Nord Stage 3 and the crash course learning the Synth section to recreate my Stage 2 programs has been fun. An excellent source of information on synthesizers and the keys to programming is the collection of SOS magazine old articles called Synth Secrets athttps://www.soundonsound.com/techniques ... d-on-sound(thanks Mr_-G- for the link!). Stage 3 synth programming tutorials can also be found atnord-stage-forum-f3/nord-stage-3-synth- ... 17063.html(thanks Ivan Jochner!), and a whole set of Nord tutorials by member "My Keys to Music" can be found on the YouTube channelhttps://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_xKuR ... BvAc63Y9qw(thanks Marc!).IMPORTANT: My NS3 is loaded with different pianos ("L" instead of "XL" versions for example) so after downloading a program you might have to relink the piano with one you have. My pianos and programs listherewill help. I also use a control pedal (Yamaha FC-7) on almost all of my programs, so one will be needed to take advantage of the morphing that's part of the programs.The program below started out as the preloaded "Furious AT Lead" program. After a bit of messing around, I came up with two variations that I thought were "interesting" and may hopefully be something that helps you further your understanding of what the Stage 3 synth can do as well. Slot A is a synth with a higher harmonic that comes in as the filter is decaying into the LFO range.  Slot B is a different synth that starts out with the following settings: LFO MOD ENV about 0, OSC CTRL on 6, FREQ on 1, and RES/FREQ on 6.  On the Slot B MP3 you can hear a percussive sound in the notes played low with the left hand; the sounds become more "aggressive" as the FREQ knob is turned slowly from 1 up to about 4 or 5 with the right hand.  All of the synth sounds heard after that are the result of turning just those four knobs and playing around. Every Synth program in the Stage 3 is an opportunity to learn, so turn, tweak, and save your work to go back to and tweak again. Have fun.Slot A WannitBBBadSyncW.mp3Slot B WannitBBBadSyncW.mp3WannitBBBadSyncW.ns3fProgramming example(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2360 timesUPDATE 12/19/2018:Below are a few more to mess around with. This first one is a program with both a record scratch effect and a synth with a LFO filter effect. The MOD ENV ATTACK determines how quickly the filter will sweep up and the MOD ENV DECAY determines the sweep down:LFOFilterSweep W.mp3LFOFilterSweep W.ns3fStage 3 program - one synth with a filter effect on the LFO, nice for solo or chords, and another synth with a record scratch effect also included.(592 Bytes) Downloaded 2495 timesThis second program I believe started with a pre-loaded program Weightless Pad that I modified with LFO filter, arpeggio, and panning effects synced to the internal clock.Weightless Pad W.mp3Weightless Pad W.ns3fModified version of Weightless Pad with filter and arpeggio effects(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2487 timesThe third program is a slightly percussive synth sound that seems to work well for solo or chords.  I add a little pan flute to it halfway through the MP3SimpleSynth    W.mp3SimpleSynth    W.ns3fSlightly percussive but muted synth(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2396 timesUPDATE 12/30/2018:This program has the new V6 Rhodes with a Hammond, a synth with random S/H on the LFO, and a synth with a triangle wave on the LFO for a pad that I bring up in volume manually in the MP3 while bringing up the volume of both with the Control Pedal. Listen through to the end with headphones to hear more of the second synth come in.  Both LFOs are synced to the internal clock.LFOSampHldSweepW.mp3LFOSampHldSweepW.ns3fStage 3 program that has a random S/H on the LFO and a triangle LFO filter effect on a pad, new v6 Rhodes, and Hammond.(592 Bytes) Downloaded 2510 timesAnalog Brass.This next program is simply a version of Analog Brass with the synth settings eliminating the need to add the Chorus effect so it can be used on the Piano. This has Velocity=1, however if you're trying to recreate an early 80s brass sound of a Prophet or Oberheim for example, Velocity should be off. The MP3 example covers the sound and then adds Slot B with a Pop Brass sample.AnalogBrass    W.mp3AnalogBrass    W.ns3fStage 3 program - Analog Brass with no chorus effect needed. Second slot has sampled Pop Brass.(592 Bytes) Downloaded 2737 timesMy Pianos and Program List as of April 2020 can be found at -->post130083.html?hilit=program%20list#p130083

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: One of the best ways to learn the ins and outs of the Stage 3 is to download programs and go through the synth and morph settings to figure out what makes them tick.  Over the last few months I’ve posted quite a few programs that may not be something you’d use playing out, but could learn from if you don’t know how you would recreate it yourself.  Below are samples of some of those programs and links to original posts. Quite a few others can be listened to at the other posts listed.  Please note that all of the programs make use of the Control Pedal. I hope you find these helpful. Take care.Automobile Engine / Motor Revving Up- Synth created and not a sample, the mod wheel is used for the engine speed. This could be used at the beginning of Living In The USA by Steve Miller Band or modified for Electric Avenue by Eddy Grant- I programmed it just to see if I couldLINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15793.htmlCar Engine W.mp3Cory Henry - “Trade It All” - Nick Semrad’s Keyboard- Program versions available where the Mod Wheel or Control Pedal will change the filter setting and drop the pitch of what's played.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p106971NS TradeItAll  W.mp3Cory Henry - Snarky Puppy - Lingus- Two of Cory Henry's solo sounds - muted synth with filter changes and "traditional" mono synth with light glideLINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 16294.htmlCory Henry Solo - King Korg.mp3Dire Straits - “Walk of Life”- B3/Leslie and Synth organ with chorusLINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p110570DS WalkOfLife  W.mp3Jefferson Starship - "Sara"- Absent a drummer, I put this together adding a little bit of a percussive sound and other effects synced to the internal clock.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15997.htmlJefferson Starship Sara JfrsonStrsSara W.mp3My Sequential Circuits Prophet 5- A few classic sounds I remember from my Prophet 5.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15996.htmlP5SynthClav_W.mp3P5SynthStab.mp3Cars Lets Go   W.mp3Stage 3 Cars Just What I Needed 2.mp3Rock Guitar - A Few Programs- B3, clean Strat and solo guitar with harmonic feedback added with Aftertouch, dual rock guitars for Eddy Money's "Two Tickets To Paradise", dual guitars for The Eagles' "Hotel California", and a rocking lead guitar with harmonic feedback (Aftertouch) and wah effect (Control Pedal) accompanied by a clean Strat.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 17012.htmlStage 3 Program - DistortedGuitr2W.mp3Eddy Money EM2Tickets2PrdzW.mp3HotelCalifornia_DualGuitars.mp3DistortedGuitr3W Demo.mp3Sir Paul McCartney and Wings - “Wonderful Christmas Time”- Classic synth with echoLINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 16675.htmlPM Wonderful Christmas Time.mp3The Beach Boys - "Good Vibrations"- Five programs put together for "Good Vibrations" by the Beach BoysLINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15858.htmlBeachBoys_GoodVibrations_WannitBBBad.mp3The Who - "Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland)"- program uses a pitch-adjusted sample with 16th notes and another with 32nd notes. The post reflects my struggle through pitch-adjusting the very small wave files used for my samples to find that Audacity needed to have "high-quality stretching" checked to correctly adjust pitch without modifying duration.  Audacity (without the box checked) and another audio editor that didn't have the high-quality stretching feature, both yielded very poor results.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 16090.htmlMP3 - Who Baba ORiley.mp3The Who - “Won’t Get Fooled Again”- Slot A and B synths with synced LFOs on organ and triangle waves with Control Pedal adjusting the Wah effect. Some add a phase shifter to their program for additional effect - I might try that too.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 16615.htmlWhoWntGetFldAgnW.mp3Tom Misch - "Crazy Dream"- A simple solo synth but time taken on programming the other synth where the notes played glide up to the proper pitch.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 16227.htmlMP3 of Program TM Crazy Dream W.mp3Van Halen - "Jump”- The OSC2 options add a lot of flexibility when programming - for "Jump" the slot A synth uses a sawtooth wave with a square wave mixed in. The second MP3 covers a NSMP sample created from the Stage 3 program.LINK->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p112686VH Jump V2 - Van Halen Jump.mp3MP3 example of Van Halen Jump W Small NSMP.mp3OTHER PROGRAMS:Spider Murphy Gang - Skandal im Sperrbezirknord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15776.htmlSkandal Im Sperrbezirk.mp3Zusammen by Fanta 4- simple use glide and bringing in second synth with control pedal.nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 16108.htmlZusammen Fanta 4.mp3My Pianos and Program List as of April 2020 can be found at -->post130083.html?hilit=program%20list#p130083

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: Starting from my "GLadyBluesStr W" program above, I changed the pianos to DX7 and Rhodes EP1 and modified the synth sections to add a light touch of voices and a pad for a Christmas Song. As dated as a DX7 sounds sometimes, what I was looking for didn't sound quite right with a Grand or Upright - the same song in a slightly different style for a different singer might change that outcome. Listen with headphones if possible to catch the background voices and pad coming in on the control pedal, you might have another use for them on something you're working on too.LINK-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... X7#p112685TheChristmasSong-DX7RhodesVoicesPad.mp3Here's a version of a Felt Piano using the Mellow Upright Bdrf C130 Piano from the Nord sitehttps://www.nordkeyboards.com/sound-lib ... ow-uprightUsing the piano samples you can't avoid the hammer sound, but the Mellow Upright with softer felt hammers works fairly well. The EQ is set with the high end taken out a little and more can be trimmed off. Similar to my "utility' program and a few others, the B3 drawbars are morphed to the Mod Wheel for additional effect (added at end of the MP3).  Take care.LINK-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p132240MP3 Example of Felt Piano  W.mp3

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: "Turn Me Loose" by Loverboy and "Gimme Gimme Gimme" by ABBA: Taking advantage of OSC2For "Turn Me Loose" by Loverboy, the stepped chromatic intro with the synth section of the Stage 3 is covered by using only OSC2 with a sawtooth waveform. I set it at 24 semitones initially so that turning the knob during performance will take it to 48 semitones (and no further) for the rest of the song. The effect is similar to the Sequential Circuits Prophet 5 where the OSC Frequency also moves in steps when the knob is turned.  The program can be found atLINK-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 20405.htmlStage 3 - Loverboy Turn Me Loose.mp3Stage 3 - Loverboy Turn Me Loose v2.mp3In order to get three synth sounds with two synth Panels for "Gimme Gimme Gimme" by ABBA, I took the approach of using a Stage 3 string sample and adding a high triangle wave with OSC 2 (balancing the two with OSC CTRL), leaving the other synth panel for the bass synth. Using a synth panel for two different sounds happened to work out in this case but you'll find that getting the "perfect" sound for one OSC sometimes means compromising on the sound of the other given that the Attack, Decay, and other synth parameters have to be applied to both. For example, my choice of triangle wave over pulse (square) wave was somewhat driven by the strings not being bright enough if I adjusted the FREQ to sound good for the square wave. If you don't need to get all the synths out of one program, flexibility opens up some. At the link below I also provide a program using an Oberheim sample provided by Funk76 for the high "flute" sound in place of the bass synth, and the strings are covered by the other synth panel. MP3s of both versions are provided below. Take care.LINK-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p137602Stage 3 - ABBA Gimme Gimme Gimme no sample.mp3Stage 3 - ABBA Gimme Gimme Gimme with sample.mp3

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: Thank you. It's been quite a while since I've updated this topic with new work so here are a few I've worked on recently:Forum memberLukedwas looking for a program for"Levitating" by Dua Lipa, so I took a shot at simulating the intro chords at first and then decided to simply sample them. Stage 3 programs and samples can be found at -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p140667DL Levitating - one-finger chords.mp3Forum memberGyauhmcontacted me about putting together a program forCher's song "Believe"- I ended up making two. For the first program I set it up so the intro pad and panning/phase shifter "strings" are on the left hand with the latter being on the Control Pedal. The right hand is set up for playing chords, but the actual sound to use is with the second program, where the left hand still has the panning/phase shifter strings and the right hand has sort-of a muted electronic clavinet. After listening to the song again, I'd speed up the phase shifter just a little bit with both programs. If you don't play in stereo you'll lose the panning effect, however you can replace it with a slow tremolo just to vary the volume a little which is similar to hearing one channel more than the other.Cher Believe 1 W.ns3f(592 Bytes) Downloaded 468 timesCher Believe 2 W.ns3f(592 Bytes) Downloaded 442 timesMP3_example_of_Stage_3_Programs_for_Believe_by_Cher.mp3I worked as well withGyauhmhelping on two programs forHelene Fischer's "Atemolos" (For the second part of the song, I downloaded a small steel drum sample to use along with strings for a little percussive effect and used the control pedal to increase the FREQ and a couple levels. The program is made so at the end the right hand can play octaves across the split. Here are MP3s created byGyauhmfor the song; the Stage 3 programs and additional information can be found with his post at -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... ml#p142027Atemlos(2)HFischer.mp3Atemlos(2)HFisch1W.mp3HF_Atemlos_W_2.mp3Forum memberNordmutt2was looking for a program to cover the "click" heard with the synth inVan Halen's "When It's Love". I put this together to get him started and to work on further. The program uses the OSC2 White Noise for the effect and it can be backed off to your taste with the Mod Wheel or turning down the MODULATION Mod Env.LINK -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p142083VH WhenItsLove W.mp3Finally, a request fromCosmic1forWhitney Houston's "How Will I Know"took me down a path of setting up three Stage 3 programs for the song and then deciding to create an all-encompassing sample for a broader group of Nord keyboards.  In the attached MP3, I'm playing along with the intro percussion loop and all sounds you hear with the exception of the DX7, and later B3 and Piano reinforcing key change for the solo/ending, are within the single sample created. Whitney Houston had such an incredible voice, we'll never know the depth of the loss on what could have been. Hopefully some of you will be able to use this. Take care.Programs with and without Samples-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p142073Sample, keyboard mapping, and other info -->nord-user-samples-nsmp-samples-f14/my-f ... ml#p142072WH HowWillKnow W Program with Sample.mp3

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: whatsupdk wrote:Thanks very much!!  MikeYou're welcome!I hope all of you are doing well. Similar to the way I started this post, here's a Stage 3 program that has quite a few things going on for those of you who want to piece it apart. The panel A synth is initially set up with the level morphed to the control pedal, a triangle wave LFO set up to affect the the OSC and filter, and the internal clock synced to the LFO, stereo pan and delay effect. The sound used has a filter decay with resonance added that becomes prominent with the LFO applied.  A B3, White Grand, and Panel B Synth are set up to be turned on at any time. The Mod Wheel is morphed to back off the LFO on the OSC/filter, turn up the filter Freq, and turn down the delay level.  The Panel B synth can be added to provide an initial attack to notes played. Here are a few examples, take care.Panel A SynthSynth LFO MW W Example - Panel A.mp3Panel A and Panel B SynthsSynth LFO MW W Example - Panel A and B.mp3Longer example: Piano with B3 and Panel A Synth levels brought up with Control Pedal, and then MW used to back off the LFO and then bring it up again.Synth LFO MW W Example - Morphed Levels and Mod Wheel.mp3Synth LFO MW   W.ns3f(592 Bytes) Downloaded 327 times

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: Hi everyone, I hope all of you are doing well. As this post has become a combination of programs to learn from and other programs/samples that hopefully may be used by some you out playing, here's a recent post of a B3 program that uses the Chorus and Stereo Pan effect in place of the slow Leslie for one panel, allowing a fast/slow/stopped Leslie to be used on the other panel without effecting it. With this combination the reverb on the B3 can also be set differently (after the effects) than the "pre-Leslie" reverb used on the other panel.  I hope this comes in handy for some of you. title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: I hope all of you are doing well. I'm now retired and finding more time to... well, anything I want! Below are links to a few programs that I worked on recently. Take care.Steely Dan's "Peg" - program and samples. This program uses two samples; one is a modified sax used as the Lyricon combined with backing vocals for the chorus, the other is a very small Clavinet sample (198 Kb) used along with the Lyricon for the intro.  Though many may not use the backing vocals, I sampled some of Michael McDonald's isolated vocals from a video on "Aja" and layered them over other backing vocals where needed to have the full chorus available.  The Lyricon has two ranges in the sample so that the notes are at the correct pitch while the Clavinet alternates between high and low notes in the intro.  The Stage 3 program has a Rhodes with Phase Shifter layered with a Clavinet with Flanger, panned slightly left and right respectively.  Pitch-corrected samples of the Lyricon/vocals are also provided for those transposing down a semitone (-1).  As this program uses only samples in the synth panels, it could easily be set up on a Stage 2 as well.  To make the MP3 demo, I made a backing track with bass, drums, and guitar at Karaoke Version - all other parts are covered by the Stage 3 program available at:LINK -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 21984.htmlFrom the program I also created a sample for players of other Nord keyboards covering the Lyricon, vocals, and layered Rhodes/Clavinet with effects that can be found at:LINK -->nord-user-samples-nsmp-samples-f14/stee ... 21985.htmlSteely Dan - Peg W DEMO.mp3Four Clavinets with Effects.Using the small Clavinet sample I put together for "Peg", I made this program just to give folks a head start on a few Clavinet settings. The program uses Clavinets on both piano panels, the sampled Clavinet, and an "analog" Clavinet sound.  On the MP3 I step through multiple settings starting with the Clavinet sample and ending with all four Clavinets layered with Flanger and Auto-Wah on both synths. The program can be found atnord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 21950.html4 Clavinets FX W Demo.mp3Rock guitar with a clean Strat for rhythm.A post by bluetrain playing a Joe Satriani song took me down the path of putting together this program using a Strat sample that I created for another post and the standard Les Paul sample with a harmonic set for OSC2 on Aftertouch, vibrato on Mod Wheel, and Wah morphed to the control pedal that adds some nice harmonics to the overall sound. The program can be found at:LINK -->post112680.html#p112680DistortedGuitr3W Demo.mp3

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: Hello all, it's been a while since I updated this post - below are links to some programs put together over the last few months."Jesus, He Knows Me" by Genesis. This program and sample cover the intro synth and pad through the song.  A B3 is added on the Mod Wheel to bring up during the Chorus. An option as well is to assign the synth vibrato to the Mod Wheel for a little more emphasis when used in the middle of the song. For the MP3 example I'm playing along with the Karaoke Version demo with the keyboards removed.Stage 3 program -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p151096NSMP Sample for other keyboards -->nord-user-samples-nsmp-samples-f14/gene ... 22152.htmlJesusHeKnowsMe W DEMO.mp3"Resistance" by MUSE. The first program has a pad left of the split and a mono synth with glide right of the split to cover the initial intro. The second program moves both synths to the left to add a soft Silver Grand to the right.  Simply by design, my old Prophet 10 tracked the highest note played when in mono mode, so I could play a full synth chord with one "panel" and have the layered mono synth of the other play just the highest note. On the Stage 3, adding a high "violin" to a full B3 chord for a song by Kansas for example could be easy if the synth featured high tracking in mono mode, however instead one has to play each chord so that the top note is the last one hit or the mono synth will go to an unintended key.  I play it carefully that way in the mp3, but having high tracking as a synth feature would be much easier.Stage 3 program -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p152351Muse Resistance2W Demo.mp3"Ashes to Ashes" by David Bowie. Forum member fuztec25 was looking for some assistance on the intro for "Ashes to Ashes" by David Bowie for his Stage 2, so I sent a few suggestions after playing around with it on my Stage 3 and then posted my program for others.Stage 3 program -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 22251.htmlStage 2 program by fuztec25 -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... 22205.htmlDB Ashes2Ashes LFO Example.mp3"Smooth" by Santana. I put together this program for a friend that includes a sample specifically for the song with a couple horn effects thrown in. The program has a B3 with the level set by the mod wheel, a Silver Grand piano, and the synth level on the Control Pedal for the brass. A second sample is provided for those who play the song down a semitone.  For the mp3 I'm playing along with the vocal, bass, and drums from Karaoke Version.Stage 3 program -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p150861Santana Smooth W Program Demo.mp3"Child Of Love" by We The Kingdom. This program uses the LFO to iterate chords played and adds a clock-synced guitar for the muted guitar note played in the intro.  A clock-synced tremolo can be adjusted to provide more or less "pulsing" between the two.Stage 3 program -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p150810ChildOfLoveLFO W Program Demo.mp3"Walking On A Thin Line" by Huey Lewis.I put this together help a Forum member get started using both synth panels and a B3 with drawbars on the Mod Wheel.Stage 3 program -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p150382HL WalkinThinLnW Program Demo.mp3

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: WannitBBBad wrote:"Turn Me Loose" by Loverboy and "Gimme Gimme Gimme" by ABBA: Taking advantage of OSC2For "Turn Me Loose" by Loverboy, the stepped chromatic intro with the synth section of the Stage 3 is covered by using only OSC2 with a sawtooth waveform. I set it at 24 semitones initially so that turning the knob during performance will take it to 48 semitones (and no further) for the rest of the song. The effect is similar to the Sequential Circuits Prophet 5 where the OSC Frequency also moves in steps when the knob is turned.  The program can be found atLINK-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 20405.htmlStage 3 - Loverboy Turn Me Loose.mp3Stage 3 - Loverboy Turn Me Loose v2.mp3In order to get three synth sounds with two synth Panels for "Gimme Gimme Gimme" by ABBA, I took the approach of using a Stage 3 string sample and adding a high triangle wave with OSC 2 (balancing the two with OSC CTRL), leaving the other synth panel for the bass synth. Using a synth panel for two different sounds happened to work out in this case but you'll find that getting the "perfect" sound for one OSC sometimes means compromising on the sound of the other given that the Attack, Decay, and other synth parameters have to be applied to both. For example, my choice of triangle wave over pulse (square) wave was somewhat driven by the strings not being bright enough if I adjusted the FREQ to sound good for the square wave. If you don't need to get all the synths out of one program, flexibility opens up some. At the link below I also provide a program using an Oberheim sample provided by Funk76 for the high "flute" sound in place of the bass synth, and the strings are covered by the other synth panel. MP3s of both versions are provided below. Take care.LINK-->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p137602Stage 3 - ABBA Gimme Gimme Gimme no sample.mp3Stage 3 - ABBA Gimme Gimme Gimme with sample.mp3I thought you used a flute sample and tweak it. How is your approach to get that gimme gimme gimme intro?

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: jalexquijano wrote:...Nevertheless, I think it lacks some detuning of the notes to sound as the original ABBA studio recording.  How do you accomplish this?As noted in my original post with the programs, one is somewhat limited with what can be done to the sound of OSC2 (the high "flute") without also affecting the sound of OSC1. Unison mode can add a detuning effect however it tends to sound bad with some samples such as the strings. I updated the program "ABBA GmeGmeGme W.ns3f" to morph chorus to the synth flute/strings when OSC2 is turned up with the Mod Wheel. You could also try the other program "ABBA GmeGmeGmesW.ns3f" which uses a sample created by Funk76 that is closer to the original analog flute sound, however the sample is 4MB and not sure worth the difference of losing use of the bass. You can go further and create your own sample to have both bass and strings on one panel, leaving the other for the synth flute (synth or sample). Good luck to you

title: RE: 100+ Programs - For those new to programming...
post_content: Given all of the new Stage 3 owners lately, I thought I'd post another program for some to learn from.  Here's a program with the NS3 Master Clock synced to the LFO rate, arpeggiator rate, A-Pan rate, and Delay tempo.  Panel A has a piano with delay, and a synth with A-Pan, Env Filter sweep (up and down), and LFO affecting the OSC1 and OSC2 X-Fade mix. Panel B has a synth with A-Pan, Env Filter sweep (down), LFO affecting the OSC1 and OSC2 X-Fade mix, and arpeggiator.  The program uses a Control Pedal on both synths to adjust the levels.After playing an initial chord in the demo, I start with the piano, bring up the Panel A synth with the control pedal, and then add the panel B synth (initially off when you load the program).  I then switch on the arpeggiator on the Panel B synth to end the demo.On their own, the Panel A and B synths can yield numerous variations on the sound just by selection of the OSC1 synth type and waveform used with the X-Fade.  Panel A for example uses an OSC1 waveform with a harmonic that comes in and out at the LFO rate.  Among other options, it's worth playing around with the OSC1 selection, pitch of OSC2, LFO waveform, and the OSC2 Ctrl.  One can then move to checking out the parameters effected by the Master Clock and how they change as the rate/tempo knobs are turned but remain synced to the Master Clock. Take care.MST CLK Sync   W.ns3f(592 Bytes) Downloaded 274 timesMST CLK Sync W NS3 Program Demo.mp3

post_content: Try the attached program. I use a control pedal to bring it in, but you could use a volume pedal or the mod wheel (although you apparently don't like that option). title: Organ Lead for Smokin' by Boston
post_content: Hi Everyone,Have any of you had any success finding the organ sounds for "Smokin'" by Boston on the NS3?  I feel like the first part of the lead is 3 draw bars out with rotor on slow, then about midway through the first part, the rotor speeds up.  I have the harpsichord part pretty well dialed in.  Then the big part (after the harpsichord) is where I'm kind of getting stumped.  Very full but brighter sounding.I'm using Song Parts to switch from sound to sound.Thanks as always for your comments and suggestions,Cheers!

title: RE: Looking for Sound Hawaiigitarre
post_content: Hello! My suggestion would be to take the E Guitar S 62 sample from the Nord Sample Library, increase the Attack time a good bit, add a little longer Release time, and utilize the pitch bend as needed. That will get you well within the Hawaiian guitar/Pedal Steel sound.

title: Ask me anything - NS3 earning its keep
post_content: I posted this on the Facebook group for NS3 users and received a lot of comments and questions, so I figured I would share here and invite conversation. I would be more than happy to share any and all of my Programs that I've been working on for a few years, after making the switch from my trusted NS2 platform. I still have most of these songs covered on the NS2 as well.The main thing I am trying to do is keep it simple - no other keyboards allowed. Just a NS3. I have worked hard with a variety of A/B slots, use of morphs, songs, etc. to dig deep into the capabilities of the NS3. I'm sharing the post I made and the setlist from a gig yesterday. I play in several bands, and this particular band's full setlist (slightly out of date) is on our website here.http://flatelvisband.com/songs-list/Hit me up if you see anything you want! My preference is to create some quick YouTube videos demonstrating how I use my programs, as they often involve some navigation of morphs and various zones on the keyboard.

Thank you for posting. Take care/

title: RE: Ask me anything - NS3 earning its keep
post_content: This is what I like in this community : sharing initiatives not business-oriented !I also have many programs for both NS2 and NS3 I can share.But I do agree some may require some "explanations" and many are just piano or EP+pad.This is what this board is all about : you can quickly start from a fresh program or load someone else work and you will tweak it to your needs !Another thing I found out over the years, is that a program shared here in the forum will trigger this song proposal in my cover bandMost of all, saving so much time with all those already customed programs is priceless !Thanks for the future sharing !Fred

For some of these sounds, there may be samples needed to go along with the Programs. Most should be from the Nord Sample Library and some were found on this forum. I'll start with just the Programs and can go locate specific samples later as needed (or tell you where to find them). title: RE: Ask me anything - NS3 earning its keep
post_content: A few caveats to the Programs above, in case I didn't fully describe things enough in the YouTube videos (which in retrospect are kind of long and boring, LOL).Anything with an organ sound will be routed to Output 3 as I always use a Ventilator. Most of the pianos will be Imperial XL or possibly Silver XL, plus CP80 Amped...you can easily substitute your piano of choice to the Programs. Any samples could already be in the stock NS3 memory or might need to be downloaded separately. I believe most are in the Nord Sample Library and a few came from this forum. As you start to review them and you find a sample that is missing, let me know and I can either point you to it, or I can go and grab it from my NS3 to upload to this thread.Enjoy! I'll do more when I get back from vacation.

title: RE: Ask me anything - NS3 earning its keep
post_content: neomad wrote:ag0stinh0 wrote:Great list! Can you share Lets Dance?Please?I've found this oneviewtopic.php?t=17417Sorry, I seem to have missed the request for Let's Dance the first time around. I'm attaching the sound I use. I don't have the time right now to make a demo recording, though I can try this weekend. Basically, I use a brass sound in the lower half of the split and a fat saw synth in the upper half of the split. I have the control pedal mapped to morph the delay wet/dry and feedback for the synth sound, so when we get to the bridge and there's that big diving type sound, I do my own take on this by sweeping up the pedal and using the pitch stick, set to drop by an octave. If you hit it just right, it sounds a bit like the recording though NS3 style, LOL.Hope this helps!Eric

title: RE: Ask me anything - NS3 earning its keep
post_content: gboneq1 wrote:Would you be able to share your patch/program you use for playing "Eminence Front?"I'm having trouble getting correct myself on my NS3Thanks in advanceSure thing. I have attached the main NS3 program as well as the sample from the Who song. There's a split with the sample in the lower portion of the keyboard. Playing C will trigger the right pitch/tempo to match the song. I have it set to hold the sample loop running, though you may want to turn this off during the verse of the song and retrigger the sample every few measures unless your drummer is really good at following the sample tempo.Above the lower split is a big layered EP sound with lots of delay and other effects. Hope you like it!

post_content: Hi You got some great songs on your list. Could you plz share the sounds/samples you use for "Shut up and dance"

title: RE: Ask me anything - NS3 earning its keep
post_content: Totmusic wrote:Hi You got some great songs on your list. Could you plz share the sounds/samples you use for "Shut up and dance"Sure thing - I don't believe I have documented this on video, though I can add this to my list to show what I'm doing. For the intro and verse sections, I am mostly laying down an atmospheric pad using the Shut Up DancePad, which has the pad on the upper side of the split (filter sweep with control pedal) and a bright electric grand sound on the lower split, which I typically play the chord stabs during the chorus.For the signature solo, check out the Shut Up Lead 2, which has two fat synth lead sounds stacked together, with the control pedal controlling volume for one of them. Sometimes I will start with the single sound and swell in the second sound to build some energy.Hope this helps!

title: RE: Final Countdown Patch Sample Playback
post_content: Winds wrote:I get the sample not found, what does that mean?Hello, it means that Nord Sound Manager could not find a NSMP3 sample that is used in a Program you have loaded. Check the post and files below it for NSMP3 files.  If this is your first time loading samples, you may need to delete some samples currently in your Stage 3 to make room for others. TheNS2 and NS3 Program Viewer, posted atnord-stage-forum-f3/ns3-program-viewer-t19939.html, will allow you to view all parameters of any Stage 2 or Stage 3 program. Using it to view the Program getting the "sample not found" error, you will be able to find out which sample the Program needs. Take care.

title: Stage 3 / Sample Editor VELOCITY HACK
post_content: The following is a quick guide to getting a semblance of velocity layering on (probably) any Nord keyboard that supports 2 or more sample layers. This will produce more defined results than attempting velocity xfades using only your Nord's native tools.I do not fancy myself a hacker or computer programmer, so if I can do this, you can do it too. Shame on Clavia for not just telling us, since it took me all of 10 minutes to figure out. That said, I assume no risk for your poor choices, yadda yadda yadda. If you brick your computer or your Nord Stage by screwing with Sample Editor projects, that's on you.Now, I'm only going to say this once, so listen well, even though I know some of you won't listen: this procedure requires a Nord Sample Editor PROJECT. It must be as yet UNCOMPILED. IT WILL NOT WORK WITH FINISHED .NSMP3 FILES!!!! Presumably it will work with .nsmp and .nsmp4, but I've only tested it on the Stage 3, which is why I'm posting here. This hack is made possible by the quasi-human-readability of the Nord Sample Editor .nsmpproj files. In theory, if somebody with more knowledge could explain the .nsmpproj architecture, more developments into more customized sample patches could be made. There are MANY more parameters (such as one-shot mode, tuning per note independent of zone/sample tuning, dynamic EQ bands, and more) that are not accessible from the GUI of Nord Sample Editor. Some of these are probably used in creation of Nord Piano files. This suggests to me that there is a possibility of authoring a sample set with multiple velocity layers, but it is beyond my technical ability, and I fussed with Nord Sample Editor for a good 5 hours yesterday trying to make it happen. Today, I am here only for the task at hand: the level 1 sample velocity hack.Without further ado, here's how to cook up a 2-layer sample patch on a Nord Stage 3.1. Build your sample sets in Nord Sample Editor. If you want to remember which layer is which, you could do as I have done, appending p (piano) to one and f (forte) to the other. Save the projects, don't export yet.2. Determine the point of velocity split. In the provided example, I am splitting at 95/96.3. Open the .nsmpproj for both sample sets in your text editor of choice.4. In the p file, find and replace all instances of "m_velocityMax = 127" with the 127 changed to your chosen split low value. Save the file.5. In the f file, find and replace all instances of "m_velocityMin = 0" with the 0 changed to your chosen split high value. Save the file.6. Open Nord Sample Editor and transfer both sample sets to your NS3.7. Select (e.g.) panel A and load the p set to it. Repeat with panel B and the f set.8. Make any desired modifications to FX, amp / filter, etc.9. Save your program, et voilà: you have finally shunted your Nord's sample playback capability a shade closer to what italways should have been.NOTE: since the 2 sample layers are on two different panels, they will not use the same FX unless you copy them 1:1 between panels. You may choose to view this as a pain in the rear or as potential for very expressive sound design with (for example) delay throws or a longer reverb on your f layer.This process is fast and painless on the Stage 3. Experimentation could be rewarding, such as a timpani and piatti combo that only sound at high velocities layered with an orchestra patch. The implications for boards with 3 or more layers are vast. If you have a Stage 4 — lucky you, you could program the Kurzweil Triple Strike Grand if you wanted. A Wave 2? FOUR distinct layers. I'm salivating.(For those curious: this demo uses Kurzweil PC2X vox samples.)msld-doo-dot.mp3

title: RE: Stage 3 / Sample Editor VELOCITY HACK
post_content: maxpiano wrote:Very interesting finding! So it seems the "seed" for managing velocity layers is already in the .nsmpproj, somehow; thanks for sharing!PS: it would cost so little to Nord to at least give access to these already existing parameters  from the GUI of Nord Sample Editor. This way you don't need to have multiple layers.It seems the velocity range change is not filtered by the Nord Sample Editor. Perhaps dual samples at the same keyrange, but different velocity ranges is also possible!This would imply many new solutions!The engine of Nord is capable of playing those setups as the piano section had multiple layers.

title: RE: Stage 3 / Sample Editor VELOCITY HACK
post_content: Eriknie wrote:...Perhaps dual samples at the same keyrange, but different velocity ranges is also possible!...Worth the try for sure but doubt this would workI remember having max 3 samples per zone in the NSE tool but Nord consider them as "takes" with in the end the selection of 1 take out of 3 (per zone).Some digging in the structure (without Nord support) will be needed (m_Zone, m_GlobalID, m_id, ...) but I'm sure some experts here will test if it is possible to assign more than 1 sample to a zone assignment based on velocity.Keep us posted !Fred

title: RE: Stage 3 / Sample Editor VELOCITY HACK
post_content: Eriknie wrote:New idea: Multi-velocity in one layerWould'n it be possible to add multiple samples in the same range in the project files with different velocity levels? This way you don't need to have multiple layers.Actually that was one of my first tests. Unfortunately as has been mentioned, NSE treats these as round robins. My NE6/NS3 will only play one of the samples, even if I have them occupying different velocity ranges.My suspicion is that the key to unlocking multiple velocities in a single file lies with the "map" class (… div? struct? param? var? I don't know what to call it) inside the NSE project file format. My best guess is that you can only have one sample (or set of samples all occupying the same velocity range if using NSL4.0-compatible boards) in a "map." You must therefore hack multiple "maps" into being within a NSE project file to get true multi-velocity sample playback. But the syntax of the NSE project file remains inscrutable to me. I do not have the brain for this.Funny trivia: I made a short 20-second video about this on TikTok and the Nord Keyboards account liked my video.Wish they had said something. Maybe time to make a YouTube video taking them to task for their tight lips.

title: RE: Stage 3 / Sample Editor VELOCITY HACK
post_content: Sharing few things here, after few tests.* the velocity hack DOES NOT WORK for nsmp (v2) format. This is bad news as I was expecting to feed my Stage 2Didn't test the nsmp4 format but it should be compatible* testing with a single WAV thrown in an NSMP3 : the values of velocity min/max are stored in HEX @0000-03ED and 03EE. Problem is there is a 4 digit value change @0000-018 to 0000-001B that I suspect to be some CRC calculation. BTW, the CRC value in the Project file ("m_crc") is not the same value as the one stored in the NSMP3..* Appreciate Nord to at least include the velocity values in the NSE when creating our own samples !Fred

title: RE: Stage 3 / Sample Editor VELOCITY HACK
post_content: Testing velocity split @63 for this DeepDrum sound made of 25 Hard and 25 Soft samples :DeepDrum_Soft.nsmp3Deep drum soft Vel 0-63 test(999.98 KiB) Downloaded 1628 timesDeepDrum_Hard.nsmp3Deep drum hard Vel 64-127 test(996.61 KiB) Downloaded 1629 timesFile comparison from standard nsmp3 shows the 4 bytes of CRC (0018-001B) and the 25 bytes changed from 127 to 64 (respectively 0 to 63) (from 03ED onwards).I'll make the ns3f and the mp3 when I get closer to my Stage 3.Fred

title: RE: Uptown Funk Pitch change from D to C sharp...
post_content: I had to do this, as my band plays everything a half step down. It was relatively easy using a program I called Transcribe:https://www.seventhstring.com/xscribe/download.htmlVery reasonable price, free updates for life.I loaded the Uptown Funk mp3 into transcribe and lowered the pitch a semitone.  Then, exported the transposed mp3.  Next, pulled the sample from the transposed mp3 and loaded it into the keyboard.You can assign it to any key, but it will now be in C#.-dj

title: RE: Cover Songs Preset Dump Part 1
post_content: You’re welcome Fred. And everyone in the community who’s helped me in one way or another. I think I’ve been on this forum for 10-11 years now (since my electro 4 purchase). And then resparked after my stage 3 purchase a year and a half ago. I like the model of paying for hardware and then sounds are free.I’ve been working on these patches for about a year and a half now. But as a steady working musician, im adding songs to it weekly. There will be more.Another side note : I use the electro 4 for organ and clav, so there is hardly none of those in these presets, you’ll have to work them in if you need. Few exceptions though when needing something more specific. My stage is piano and synth duty.

title: RE: Cover Songs Preset Dump Part 1
post_content: I also have plenty of programs I'll share.Issue is that after buying my Stage 3 88, I kept my NS2 compact. Therefore, removed some splits on the NS3 to transfer to the NS2 : many programs are not usable (not even mentioning the nsmp3 not compatible with the nsmp) as a stand alone for the NS3.I also really like the philosophy of sharing programs that are most of the time a great starting point that will save you tremedous amount of time and makes you concentrate on your playing skills (if any) !Fred

title: RE: Preset Synth 80s ?
post_content: Hi and welcome to NUF, you can do free text searching using the "Search..." box at top right of tis forum page or take a look at the fellow sitewww.nordusersounds.com(but I suggest you also to spend some time and browse through your NS3 Synth Presets, not just the Programs and also learn how to tweak them, studying the Synth section of the manual)

title: RE: Preset Synth 80s ?
post_content: I don't know the correct Roland expression, but in the Yamaha Universe this is exact the "Virtuoso" Lead Sound. It is used in Tyros, Genos and PSR-S, but should also be found in the Motif / Montage ROM. Very interesting that it has a automatic-Modulation after ~2sec, what is very useful for NordElectro-user (w/o Mod-Wheel). You should check such a Key at Musicians in your local area or / and rent one from a friendly collegue. Then just start your Sample Editor...

title: RE: Crazy seal
post_content: Due to no reply here, and that the architecture of ns4 is wildly different form ns3 (so no, you can't just upload the sound posted ...well you can, but it doesn't work)... I ended up I creating 3 (full) programs that sound very close. All band members very happy with it. I hold sustain and move between them. 1 2 3.  Main riff can be uploaded but doesn't sound like eh mp3 but it's a start.  It's:1 is syth in base plus femal oooh right hand2. an orchestral hit left, and the main riff on right3. syth on left and main riff of rightYou get the right sound if you use the downloadable synth sound here, put into 2 slots, change one into to "blues organ" syth... and support it with B3 organ over it too (40% volume).no idea what syth he used, but the "trick" was using the organ sound.  I'm no programmer, so it doesn't quite have the "sweep" but hitting  harder and harder mimics that effect just enough to sound right.Happy to share bit no idea how to

title: Bye Bye Love & Just Like Heaven - Each in just one Program
post_content: Hey friends,I shared a bunch of my Programs and some video demonstrations in this thread:nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 21504.htmlThanks for all the responses and downloads! My gifts to the forum.I played a gig last night and realized I love it when I'm able to play an entire song without ever changing programs. Here I'm sharing two Programs for Bye Bye Love by The Cars and Just Like Heaven by The Cure. These songs both have a bunch of things going on and I've kept them within the constraints of a single Program, through a use of splits, layers, and morphs. The NS3 can really do a lot and I love trying to push it to its limits.Bye Bye Love[BBvideo=425,350]<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IL03QDKZR10" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>[/BBvideo]Just Like Heaven[BBvideo=425,350]<iframe width="560" height="315" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jdhh2ijbCL4" title="YouTube video player" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>[/BBvideo]For anyone that can't access the embedded YouTube videos, here are direct links:Enjoy!Eric

title: Any Colour You Like - Pink Floyd Synth&Organ
post_content: I kept listening to the original song and this sound back and forth for an hour and a half but it was worth it! Kept tweaking constantly and I think it might be 90% there. The delay feedback might sound a bit too much but that's to compensate for losing a lot when heard in the mix with the rest of the instruments. It might also sound a just a bit brighter - for the same reason. The only thing I couldn't match to the original was the stereo image the original synth has(which can be achieved using the a-pan but I would have to use the second synth engine for the delay only and I wouldn't match the sound exactly)Have fun and keep contributing to this forum so that we can grow OUR stage 3 library!Left of the split is the organ starting with a Dm on 2nd inversion and then changing to a G.Any color you like stage 3.mp3

title: RE: The Doors presets
post_content: Hi Guys, I'm on a NE6D and I play in a Doors tribute band. I'm looking to mimic as many Doors sounds as possible. I'm pretty new to the Nord world but, if I understand correctly, .ns3f files are stage piano program files, so they won't help. To my knowledge, I can't convert the program files either. I was wondering if you can give any advice about which patch to start with (or patches to mix) and which effects to apply. I'm planning to post something on the general forum too, but I noticed this thread and was hoping you guys might have some input too. There are several songs I am looking to mimic:For example, in Hello, I Love You, I think Rey Manzarek used a Gibson G101 with some kind of percussion and sustain setting on it. I am excited to try the patch Supertrampfanboi shared above (thank you!), but I'd still need an effect to get that buzz sound. Any ideas?Riders on the Storm is a Rhodes, obviously, but I think I hear tremolo and maybe a phaser in the original recording?Not to Touch the Earth: no idea what organ he used, nor how they got the weird psychedelic floaty, bendy sound. My hypothesis is that it is a Gibson G101 and they used the bend switch on the proprietary volume pedal those organs had. How could I mimic it?For Love Her Madly, Moonlight Drive, etc., Ray was playing a tack piano, which my NE6D has a near perfect sound for (labeled as a honkey tonk piano) for these Doors songs. It sounds just like it.I also has a Yamaha MODX8 and Yamaha has always had great default Vox Continental organ sounds for the Doors' early recordings, it's one thing that has kept me a Yamaha customer. My S80 had a perfect Vox and so does the MODX. Interestingly, it sounds more dead on to the Doors recordings compared to the NE6D.

title: RE: The Doors presets

The information will help you recreate anything using the piano and/or organ on your NE6D and samples to the extent they aren't heavily modified with the Stage synth settings. Good luck!

title: RE: The Doors presets
post_content: Zerb Bot wrote:WannitBBBad, do you know whether you can sample the Yamaha in Sample editor via usb or would I need to mic an amp? I did a quick tutorial search and didn’t find a matching scenario.I have a simple setup where my keyboard stereo audio routes directly into my laptop and I record the audio with Audacity. I bypass any unnecessary source of extraneous noise that might affect the quality of the sample. The Nord Sample Editor v4 will let you record directly from a source audio input into the app, however I prefer the flexibility of starting with a WAV file using Audacity and then just dragging the file into the sample editor with it assigning the keys to the notes sampled. Given you can add effects with your NE6D, it would be better to record your Yamaha without effects if possible (turn off reverb, chorus...) to give you more control of the final sound. If you have the ability to use USB from your mixer as the audio input to your laptop, that should work well, but in all cases (USB or audio mic/line input) you need to watch your levels so the audio doesn't clip. Let me know if you have other questions - if a lot of this is new to you, just let me know what you need clarification on. Take care

title: RE: The Doors presets
post_content: Shak69wrote:↑14 Feb 2025, 02:22Hey what sample is in the synth section for that patch? when i look at it in program viewer it says sample not foundHi Shak69. The sample is "Jim and Storm" posted above by @lingiu. Added again here for convenience:JIM_AND_STORM.nsmp32 things to note:1) you need to download the sample and add it to your sample library;2) even if you have the sample dowloaded, if it's in a different location than the ns3f file that you loaded into program viewer, the synth slot says "file not found". To fix in your program, select the correct sample from your sample library. lingiu's RidersOntheStorm program references sample 88, but I stuck the "Jim and Storm" sample in location 6 in my library, so I just selected that for my program.lingiuwrote:↑30 Oct 2021, 16:06Hi guysthis is my Riders on the Storm implementation, including storm and Jim voice samplesStorm sample is located on the left of the keyboards up to the first C note on NordStage3 Compact. Jim Voice starts from first D note on the left of th keyboardI tweaked the great work by lingiu to suit my playing style and perception of the "Riders" sound.Riders on Doors.ns3f(592 Bytes) Downloaded 57 timesThis sound uses EP4  because Manzarek's Rhodes sound seems to have less tine than some of the other Nord EP's. Panel A has EP2 tweaked to sound like a Rhodes bass, plus the option to dial in Fend Prec Direct sample with the mod wheel, because the Doors added a bass player on the recording. (The stupid name is so I can find the sound by search Riders or Doors)Enjoy.

title: The Who - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) - Sampled & Tuned
post_content: ajstan wrote:Try this link:REVISED WITH NEW SAMPLES. Great video created by My Keys To Music that helped a bit in approaching this sampled version of the Who song. Note that using these samples requires that you play the song in the original key or the tempo will be wrong.The original recorded Lowrey was a bit sharp, so I took the Intro and dropped the pitch to be in tune to the piano for the first sample. Audacity and AVS4YOU should be able to change the pitch without changing the tempo, but neither did well with the very short duration samples (1/4 - 2 seconds) I used the first time. Based on the exchange below, I found out from Audacity that the latest version has a checkbox to indicate you want high quality sampling. If you have the same problem with changing the pitch of a sample, try the latest version of Audacity in high quality mode.The sample with the 32nd notes was created by cutting off the last half of each 16th note (C, D, F, G) and cut-n-pasting the first half again. I don't know the song yet but I play through a few notes on the MP3 so you get an idea of what you have.The bottom split has "WhoBabaORileyFGW.nsmp3" with the intro pattern on the F key and a pattern on the G key for when the song changes to a C chord. The middle split is the piano. The top split is the second sample "WhoBabaORiley32W.nsmp3" with the 32nd notes. It doesn't matter which sample memory locations you store new samples in your Nord Stage 3, just make sure that after you load the program, that you point the Slot A and Slot B Synth to the correct sample in your system. For example, if you load the "WhoBabaORiley32W.nsmp3" into your sample location 280 (287 in mine), then you just need to point Slot A to 280 rather than 287.UPDATE 4/6/19. For those new to Stage 3 programming, Marc (My Keys To Music) just posted a new video showing folks how to put together this program athttps://youtu.be/pYelOuB-G3w. Thanks Marc!  Take care all.MP3 - Who Baba ORiley.mp3PROGRAM:WhoBabaORiley  W.ns3fProgram - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) by The Who(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2680 timesDon't forget to load both NSMP3 samples attached belowNSMP samples posted here -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... ml#p106851Programs added by KeyBard covering the 73 Compact using a different split and adding another program for the violin partLINK -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p12954190+ Stage 3 Programs and MP3 examplesLINK -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15748.htmlWho Baba O'Riley Teenage Wasteland

title: RE: The Who - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) - Sampled & Tuned
post_content: Thanks for the perfect samples. I had grabbed them a few weeks ago, but found that the proposed splits (piano in the middle) don't work on the ns3 compact since it doesn't have a high-F key like the ns3 76! So I put the 32 synth part between the FG synth and the piano. This also allows me to play the 32 synth with my left hand while playing the piano with my right rather than having to use my left hand for the piano part as you demonstrated (and doing a fuller chord on the piano since I can't hold the bass piano key as well).I took it a step further by pressing the ARP RUN key and then quickly hitting the low C key to get the automatic repeating 8th note that gets played when Roger sings "We're all wasted". I then copied this program to a second program where I replaced the 32 synth and piano parts with another synth where I used the "Strings Quartet Solo Vib" sample with sufficient mucking about in the Delay, and Amp sections so that while the FG synth is repeating the C key ad nauseam (while dropping the Decay to 288ms with the Arpeggiator set to 1/16T with ARP RUN and KB HOLD keys on), I can play the violin part through to the end and on the very last note simply press the KB HOLD key off to silence everything. I switch to this second program right after the last piano chord is played with the guitar "solo".  I hope this was clear. Try it. It sounds amazing.

And I haven't been able to find anything describing what Townshend played for the recording.  Also, wondering what others are doing to cover the Irish jig at the end. title: RE: The Who - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) - Sampled & Tuned
post_content: epaley wrote:Let me ask what should hopefully be an easy question.  The Lowry sample is awesome, but I'm struggling to decide what piano to layer over it.  I've tried a few of the Nord offerings, but they all seem almost too "clean" as compared to the original.  And I haven't been able to find anything describing what Townshend played for the recording.  Also, wondering what others are doing to cover the Irish jig at the end.  Been playing the violin solo with a Nord sound, but the background arpeggios are different than what's going on at the beginning ... at least, I think they are.  Appreciate any insights.Yes, the piano is a little "darker" on the recording.  I think I used the Grand Lady D on this, which could be EQ'd a little, but you might want to see how it comes across playing live.  If your rig isn't going through the PA, you probably don't want to take any of the brightness off that will naturally happen with the room.The WAV files I posted could be used to create the ending by piecing together individual notes or you could record the riff using the 32nd notes sample and then create a new sample with it playing in a loop.  Attached is one for the C note playing just before the violin comes in.  The timing can be adjusted using Audacity or other audio editing software, or you could opt to play the note manually so the timing is easier to transition to which is slower than the intro. I hope this helps, take care.

title: RE: The Who - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) - Sampled & Tuned
post_content: daveisc00l wrote:Has anyone figured out how to play this sample to a click? My band will perform this song with a click in our ears and I can have midi clock sent to the Nord so it's locked to the click but the sample loops on its own... I wonder how I could figure this to sync with a click... any ideas?Hello, and welcome to the Forum!  If you set the left-hand sample "WhoBabaORiley16W mono.nsmp" (or "WhoBabaORileyFGW.nsmp3") on "hold" and play along with a click set for 118 BPM, you can periodically just hit the "F" note again to retrigger and line back up with the click as needed. The tempo changes toward the end before the violin solo. KeyBard provided a mp3hereif you want to listen to that transition. I hope this helps, good luck!

title: RE: The Who - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) - Sampled & Tuned
post_content: Theo_silva wrote:Do you guys have something similar to NE6?Hello, and welcome to the Forum! The problem is that you need a single sample that will cover what I use at different ends of the keyboard on my Stage 3 with two samples. An option for you is to load "WhoBabaORiley16W mono.nsmp" and "WhoBabaORiley32W.nsmp3" into your NE6, and then use Nord Sample Editor 4 to create a NSMP3 file sampling the notes. With NSE4 you would have the option of putting both into a small range on the NE6 with the piano covering the other, or setting it up with the 16th notes at the low end and 32nd notes at the high end with the center section of the sample silent for the range covered by piano. You would be able to have the intro 16th notes continue to loop using the sustain pedal, but it would affect the piano as well, so no sustain on the piano might sound better. Good luck!

title: RE: The Who - Baba O'Riley (Teenage Wasteland) - Sampled & Tuned
post_content: WannitBBBadwrote:↑03 Sep 2018, 17:41ajstan wrote:Try this link:REVISED WITH NEW SAMPLES. Great video created by My Keys To Music that helped a bit in approaching this sampled version of the Who song. Note that using these samples requires that you play the song in the original key or the tempo will be wrong.The original recorded Lowrey was a bit sharp, so I took the Intro and dropped the pitch to be in tune to the piano for the first sample. Audacity and AVS4YOU should be able to change the pitch without changing the tempo, but neither did well with the very short duration samples (1/4 - 2 seconds) I used the first time. Based on the exchange below, I found out from Audacity that the latest version has a checkbox to indicate you want high quality sampling. If you have the same problem with changing the pitch of a sample, try the latest version of Audacity in high quality mode.The sample with the 32nd notes was created by cutting off the last half of each 16th note (C, D, F, G) and cut-n-pasting the first half again. I don't know the song yet but I play through a few notes on the MP3 so you get an idea of what you have.The bottom split has "WhoBabaORileyFGW.nsmp3" with the intro pattern on the F key and a pattern on the G key for when the song changes to a C chord. The middle split is the piano. The top split is the second sample "WhoBabaORiley32W.nsmp3" with the 32nd notes. It doesn't matter which sample memory locations you store new samples in your Nord Stage 3, just make sure that after you load the program, that you point the Slot A and Slot B Synth to the correct sample in your system. For example, if you load the "WhoBabaORiley32W.nsmp3" into your sample location 280 (287 in mine), then you just need to point Slot A to 280 rather than 287.UPDATE 4/6/19. For those new to Stage 3 programming, Marc (My Keys To Music) just posted a new video showing folks how to put together this program athttps://youtu.be/pYelOuB-G3w. Thanks Marc!  Take care all.MP3 - Who Baba ORiley.mp3PROGRAM:WhoBabaORiley  W.ns3fDon't forget to load both NSMP3 samples attached belowNSMP samples posted here -->nord-stage-2-programs-ns2p-ns2pb-files- ... ml#p106851Programs added by KeyBard covering the 73https://mineapkhub.com/Compact using a different split and adding another program for the violin partLINK -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... ml#p12954190+ Stage 3 Programs and MP3 examplesLINK -->nord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15748.htmlWho Baba O'Riley Teenage WastelandGreat breakdown! The updated samples and programming tips are super helpful, especially with Audacity’s high-quality mode. Thanks for sharing the resources!

title: RE: Shine on you crazy diamond (Pink Floyd), Jump (Van Halen)
post_content: Since it was not saved as a Bundle it makes sense that the EPs where missing; both Piano and Synth samples are referenced by name on your NS3 (so if the .nsmp you loaded had a different name in the NS3 Program, when it was saved, it won't be found and you have to relink it manually)

title: RE: Shine on you crazy diamond (Pink Floyd), Jump (Van Halen)
post_content: AlbertoG wrote:Hello,I'm having the same problem. I'm unable to play the sound since it doesn't point out to the right samples or Synth sounds. Could someone help?Welcome to the Forum! Regarding the EPs noted above, the Nord Sound Manager will list sounds/samples that are missing even if they aren't actually used in the program.  If you don't have the EPs listed, you can download it from the Nord site or simply point to another just to get rid of the error.  For the sample, check which of two synth panels is set up to use a sample, and then relink it to the new NSMP3 sample you loaded either using your NS3 or using the Nord Sound Manager.  Check the synth levels - if they are morphed to the control pedal and you're not using one, the level will be at zero.When you start working with samples and want to start saving new ones, here are a few tips for Sound Manager:- View your current samples in "organize" mode to show open memory locations.- Sort samples from largest to smallest and delete the ones you don't need starting with the largest so you're freeing up the most space without losing as many samples.- Save all new samples to memory locations 250 and above so you always know which ones you loaded versus which ones came with your Stage 3.Below is a link to access over 70 programs I have put together for the Stage 3 that might be of help to you in the future. Take care.Programs, MP3 examples, and links to many othersnord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15748.html

title: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: I use Forsore and bluetooth MIDI to send program changes on my NS2  but I just got an NS3. Program changes are working the same. No Problem.I need help understanding the MIDI settings forSong mode.Example: Song mode uses MSB CC#0 = 1 and LSM CC#32 = 0- plus program number.Song mode is banks of 50 songs.I experimented and If I use MIDI 3 (keyboard) 1 (song) 4  Bank - 46 program I get Song 3:10 which I would think is Bank 3 program 10.What am I not understanding?The diagram on Nord user Manual shows (0-3) for Bank I think which makes no sense.Uf my MIDI settings are 3 - 1 - 7 - 96 I get song 4:45?  (I'm using MIDI 3 for the receiiving channel)

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: Hi-The text above that diagram reads:Changing Programs, Songs, Synth Presets and Live programs respectively on the Nord Stage 3will send Program Change messages according to the table below– as long as Program Change is set to be sent in the MIDI menu that is.I am not sure that the songs themselves willreceiveany midi information, as they are just pointers to the actual programs that are used. If the Program changes are working as expected, put the NS3 in song mode and then send the program changes and see if the change corresponds to the program and not the song.  I have not tested this, so I cannot be sure. Also, if you have the external device successfully sending program changes, you can set the order of changes in that device, not needing Song Mode at all.-dj

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: Mapping is not 1:1 for Song Mode, you can use this app to help you decode ithttps://www.schroederonline.de/midimapperanyway looking at NS3 manual Song Mode chapter you can read that you have"a total of 8 banks of 50 songs each"which are mapped to 4 Banks x 100 locations in terms of MIDI.So for example first Song (0) of Bank B (2) on NS3 corresponds to MSB = 1 LSB= 0 and PC = 50 in terms of MIDI Bank + Program Change messagesThat would select the corresponding NS3 Song, but not the slots (Programs) inside the song, on the other hand if you are using an external Setlist manager (app), you can avoid using NS3 Song mode at all and manage the individual Program Changes directly from the app.

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: In your example Song 0 would actually be 1:01 the lowest song listed.If there are 4 banks of 50 then song 1:49 should be 1-0-49 but instead it brings up song 1:10 and 1-1-49 brings up song 1:35?I downloaded the app you listed but see no instruction so I'm not sure how it works

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: ttsing4u wrote:In your example Song 0 would actually be 1:01 the lowest song listed.If there are 4 banks of 50 then song 1:49 should be 1-0-49 but instead it brings up song 1:10 and 1-1-49 brings up song 1:35?I downloaded the app you listed but see no instruction so I'm not sure how it worksJust a check: do you have ProgramandControl Change receive (or send/receive) enabled on NS3?Try this then (easier): connect the NS3 via USB to a computer/tablet running a MIDI Monitor, ensure you have enabled send/receive of Program and Control Changes in NS3 MIDI Menu and look at what you get.The app is pretty self-explanatory: select your device, then the mode from the drop-down list (Song Mode in your case) then dial the Song number you want and look at the MIDI parameters below. App discussion is herehttps://www.norduserforum.com/nord-stag ... 23492.html

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: I purchased the app and downloaded it. However, when I select Song Mode, it shows midi (0-127) but it is very hard to determine what the scheme is because in Song Mode the programs go 1-50 (0-49). It shows Bank (MSB) and Sub Bank (LSB). Trying to determine the actual Song Number in this app and how it corresponds to the arrangement of songs in the instrument is difficult.When I sent program change messages directly from my NW2 to my NS3, when in Song Mode the PC message disabled it and returned to program mode.  I understand the confusion of the OP, and I am still unsure if the Song Mode responds to incoming program change at all.  The manual says it sends, but says nothing about receiving. Perhaps the software author could shed some light on the Song Mode architecture and how it addresses the Songs in the NS3--dj

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: I've got a MSB-LSB-PC calculator sheet from somewhere on the forum. Haven't tested if it's correct - but in any case it's different from the manual. It starts withsong bank 1, song no 1, program 1 which is translated into MSB 1, LSB 0, PC 0 and continuessong bank 1, song no 1, program 2song bank 1, song no 1, program 3...song bank 1, song no 2, program 1 which is translated into MSB 1, LSB 0, PC 5etc.According to that sheet, you wouldn't number songs, but still programs within a song - and there are 5 per song.So, e.g.song bank 4, song no 45, program 2 would translate into MSB 1, LSB 7, PC 96.Found it. There's no need of paying any app. Everything's there:https://www.norduserforum.com/nord-stag ... 17041.html

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: FZiegler wrote:I've got a MSB-LSB-PC calculator sheet from somewhere on the forum. Haven't tested if it's correct - but in any case it's different from the manual. It starts withsong bank 1, song no 1, program 1 which is translated into MSB 1, LSB 0, PC 0 and continuessong bank 1, song no 1, program 2song bank 1, song no 1, program 3...song bank 1, song no 2, program 1 which is translated into MSB 1, LSB 0, PC 5etc.According to that sheet, you wouldn't number songs, but still programs within a song - and there are 5 per song.So, e.g.song bank 4, song no 45, program 2 would translate into MSB 1, LSB 7, PC 96.Found it. There's no need of paying any app. Everything's there:https://www.norduserforum.com/nord-stag ... 17041.htmlAnd this is what I thought, there is no way to call up Songs by their number.  Songs do not respond to program change message, only programs do. So, using the method above you can call the 5 different programs within a song. Seems much more complicated than just calling the programs in the order you want them from the app.Thanks, FZ--dj

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: Connect the midi out from the Nord to midi in into your pc/tablet. Open a midi application on your pc.On the Nord change song or program and see on your pc the midi message.

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: I may have found a workaround. If I send program changes WITH song mode engaged, pc  0-4 plays song 1 parts 1-5, pc  5-9 song 2 parts 1-5 and so on. Not sure if this will work for everybody but I’m hoping it works for me!

title: RE: HELP Assigning MIDI in Song mode
post_content: masterzaffro wrote:I may have found a workaround. If I send program changes WITH song mode engaged, pc  0-4 plays song 1 parts 1-5, pc  5-9 song 2 parts 1-5 and so on. Not sure if this will work for everybody but I’m hoping it works for me!Of course it works, as far as you stay in Song mode; but if you need to switch mode (or to be sure you don't forget to switch to Song Mode) or to go beyond the 100th Song part you have to use Bank Change MSB/LSB, no workaround possible.

title: Edgar Winter Frankenstein - “normal” synth parts
post_content: Hi everyone,I see in my search a lot of questions regarding the modulated section of Frankenstein, I’m not even worried about that. I however would love some direction to a comparable synth sound for the main riffs and runs and solo before the modulation stuff. I think I just broke myself listening to hundred of sounds between my nord and Fantom and I’ve given myself a migraine trying to get something even close enough to tweak. Anyone ever do this song? Is it just me and some sort of weird blind spot? Any advice?

title: RE: Edgar Winter Frankenstein - “normal” synth parts
post_content: wanderjoewrote:↑11 Nov 2024, 00:49Hi everyone,I see in my search a lot of questions regarding the modulated section of Frankenstein, I’m not even worried about that. I however would love some direction to a comparable synth sound for the main riffs and runs and solo before the modulation stuff. I think I just broke myself listening to hundred of sounds between my nord and Fantom and I’ve given myself a migraine trying to get something even close enough to tweak. Anyone ever do this song? Is it just me and some sort of weird blind spot? Any advice?Yeah.  The name of the song was chosen as a result of all the studio work that went into the track.  You're hearing an array of modular synths for the most part, along with organ and a few standard Moogs.I've seen bands try it live -- even with two keyboardists -- and it usually sucks bigtime.  So for me  it's on that short list of songs that really can't be done well live for 99% of bands.Your best bet would be to assemble an array of software modular synths on an iPad and get busy with programming.

title: RE: Everybody Wants To Rule The World
post_content: Hi all,Just got my Stage 3 (new Nord owner) and trying to dial in my sounds for some band songs where I play keyboard accompaniment.I loved the sample on this one works great but wondered if I could get advice on a couple other sounds:1) The very first notes of the song - I believe D A D F(#) - almost like a piano/bell sound?2) Verse 1 & 2 (e.g. “welcome to your life”) it’s a softer sound like he dialed down the saw or something?  Ideas what to use there?Bonus newb question:How do I balance the volumes?  When I play the sample above it’s much louder than even if I bang away at the keyboard with other sounds (e.g. 80s Summer Synth).Thank you!

title: RE: Everybody Wants To Rule The World
post_content: blackjack447 wrote:Bonus newb question:How do I balance the volumes?  When I play the sample above it’s much louder than even if I bang away at the keyboard with other sounds (e.g. 80s Summer Synth).Thank you!Hello, and welcome to the Forum!  You'll find the the B3 sets back in the mix a little when played along with the piano, so I typically back off the piano and then adjust the synth level from there. Though settings vary quite a bit, for songs with a piano I will usually set the piano about -2db and then adjust the synth level to where it needs to be. For additional flexibility I typically "morph" the synth Level to my Control Pedal so I can fade in parts easily. Good luck to you.

title: My Sequential Circuits Prophet 5
post_content: I bought my Prophet 5 (#0186) around 1980 from Paul Delph who played the infamous keyboard part on Toni Basil's "Mickey".  Paul was brilliant and classically-trained; I replaced him in a local band when he headed to California in the late 70s.  More about Paul can be found athttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_DelphSadly, Paul passed away in 1996.  Paul's Prophet 5 was loaded with all kinds of sounds completely new to me - below are a few programs that remind me of that time.One of the first sounds I remember using on the Prophet 5 was a synth version of the Hohner clavinet.  This covers it well but also adds in the dynamics of touch-sensitivity and effects the Prophet 5 didn’t have.  The MP3 starts with just the Synth Clavinet, a few notes follow turning the OSC control to change the character of the clavinet sound, then adding synth brass, sampled D5 clavinet, and B3.P5SynthClav_W.mp3P5SynthClav    W.ns3fProgram - P5SynthClav - Electronic Clavinet(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2295 timesThe first time I heard this next sound was on an old practice tape I have of Paul playing with John Goodsall and others, not sure if it was the band Zoo Drive practicing.P5SynthStab.mp3P5SynthStab    W.ns3fProgram - P5SynthStab(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2186 timesThe Cars made this sound popular with the song “Let’s Go”.Cars Lets Go   W.mp3Cars Lets Go   W.ns3fProgram - "Let's Go" by the Cars(574 Bytes) Downloaded 2615 timesHere's another for the Cars - Just What I Needed. This one uses both synths as each is used in the song and then combined at the end. The LFO settings for each are different for the end of the song (fast on the square wave, slower on the sawtooth):Stage 3 Cars Just What I Needed 2.mp3CarsJstWhatINeeW.ns3fProgram - CarsLstWhatINeeW - The Cars - Just What I Needed(592 Bytes) Downloaded 2139 timesPrograms, MP3 examples, and links to many othersnord-stage-3-programs-ns3p-ns3pb-files- ... 15748.html
