title: RE: Request: Spider Murphy Gang - Skandal im Sperrbezirk
post_content: I always just used the Hammond sound.If you want, you can add a flanger or phaser for the “solo”, but just using the plain organ works fine, and nobody ever complained in about 200 gigs.

title: RE: Request: Spider Murphy Gang - Skandal im Sperrbezirk
post_content: Hi,which organ settings do you use for this sound (drawbars, effects, leslie ...)? Am also interested into it

title: RE: Request: Spider Murphy Gang - Skandal im Sperrbezirk
post_content: I always played this one on my Electro 2. Completely generic — something like first three or four drawbars out, no chorus, no percussion, slow Leslie.Lower volume for the verses.For the "solo", I'd just hold the high A, and then add and hold the G, E, D, C, and A, and then dramatically smear down and back up for the second round. The frontman would feature me at this point, and the crowd would eat it up.Of course, once that "solo" was through, I'd use the crowd attention, immediately add V3 vibrato and switch directly into the intro for "Ich will Spaß" (in G), without pause.

title: Help with Electric Piano Patch from Charlie Puth's "Patient"
post_content: Hello! I'm trying to emulate the electric piano patch from Charlie Puth's "Patient". You can hear it here:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uKmA0nHe4noI am working with a couple of songwriters and they really like this patch... I believe the closest of the Epianos is the Epiano 1 Mk I.... I tried adding some Trem, a little bit of Vibe and Delay... But there's this woody flavor to it that I can't put my finger on... Maybe there's another Epiano layered on Panel B??? I have a Nord Stage 3...  Anyone of the super Nord superheroes out there able to help?!Warm regards,Rod

title: RE: Help with Electric Piano Patch from Charlie Puth's "Patient"
post_content: That’s gorgeous...almost Wurlitzer-like.There’s some distortion in the amp — sounds like it could be a Twin or an AC30, and the final signal is heavily compressed.Playing with a lot of dynamics will give it that grit.

title: RE: Help with Electric Piano Patch from Charlie Puth's "Patient"
post_content: It is surely Wurlitzer. But maybe not a patch, rather a real one. You can hear the mechanical noises, which are not present in the Stage's Wurlitzer.Use the amped version of Wurlitzer, and compress it with an outboard.

title: Favorite B3 Programs
post_content: What are some of your favorite B3 programs? Care to share them?I’m new to the Stage 3 myself. I dig the stock “B3 Full” program, and I’m learning how to modify it to get some great sounds.I play a lot of Allman Brothers, Widespread Panic, Grateful Dead, Black Crowes...that sort of thing.Any shared programs or programming tips would be most appreciated, thanks!Kirby

title: RE: Favorite B3 Programs
post_content: I’m also looking to dial in a killer sound (drawbars, vib/cho, perc, reverb) for the reggae-style songs I play.

title: RE: Favorite B3 Programs
post_content: I usually start with a base of 888000000 or 888800000 and adjust the upper drawbars as appropriate to how the band sounds and how much bite I want the organ to have.C3 if I want extra presence and shimmer.Percussion usually 2nd soft, fast, when I want extra bite.Reggae, I’d start with 800000000 for the “du whoo-ka” organ offbeat fills for late-70s roots stuff. Some distortion.If you’re looking for something more aggressive like on Marley’s “Talking Blues” album, 888000000 or 880000000 and lots of drive.

title: Mark Forster - Chöre (Choere)
post_content: Hi,I'm looking for the sounds of the song "Chöre" from Mark Forster, especially but not only the one which is kind of "morphed" after the verse (when the backgriudn choir sings "oho oho oho oohh"). Does anyone has created this for the NS3?Thanks so much!Best regards, Georg

title: RE: Mark Forster - Chöre (Choere)
post_content: That’s just a piano through a low-pass filter.Assign the EQ/amp sim section to the piano and set it to "LP24” — that’s a low pass filter (Tiefpassfilter) with a Q (Flankensteilheit) of 24 dB per octave.Turn resonance fairly low and cutoff all the way down. As you play the piano pattern, open up the cutoff gradually to let more of the sound come through.

title: Nordsound libraries download as a whole
post_content: Hi and hello to all of you,I'm new in the forum and using a Nord Stage 3 Compact since a couple of days, first time playing a Nord after having used Roland Fantoms and Yamaha Motifs/MOXFs on stage for the past 20 years or so ....I am very interested in the additional sounds from Nord's sound libraries, does anyone know if there is a way to download the Nord sound libraries (Nord Piano Library, Nord Sample Library 3.0) as a whole, instead of selecting each sound individually for download?Thanks a lot and best regards, Georg

title: RE: Nordsound libraries download as a whole
post_content: Hi, and welcome!To answer your question, not really, more of a pick and chose what you like type of approach.

title: RE: Nordsound libraries download as a whole
post_content: Hmm ok .. bit more work on the PC then

title: RE: Nordsound libraries download as a whole
post_content: There is not a single instrument in the Nord line, even the last one, that could load ALL the samples of the Nord Library...So, you have to ask yourself what you really need contrary to the other manufacturers who put as much as they can in the instrument but ask you to pay for any extra afterwards....

title: RE: Nordsound libraries download as a whole
post_content: Precisely to Quai34's point- the most effective approach is to understand the type of sound sample you want, then audition the ones in that category. For example, most of what I looked for are basses, some chromatic percussion, leads and pads. I don't have a lot of need for the Mellotron library or orchestra samples.With regard to downloading, you can download the specific collection as a zip file or each sample individually.Did you buy your Stage 3 new? Do they include the sound library DVDs anymore?

title: RE: Nordsound libraries download as a whole
post_content: That’s clear to me - my point is that the room for rehearsal where the Stage is located does not have an internet or WiFi connection, I therefore want to save everything on my PC to have it available for testing when working with the Stage.Yes I bought a new one and the piano library is included, so would need the sample library if the content of the piano library disc is the same like the one available for downloadGesendet von iPhone mit Tapatalk Pro

title: NS3 Bundle format
post_content: Is there a standard file format for bundles? have been trying unsuccessfully to download a bundle in .ns3sbundle format (on this forum Corley Worship Bundle). My NS3 (os 1.40) and Sound Manager (7.30) only seems to recognise .ns3fb files. What am I doing wrong please?

title: RE: NS3 Bundle format
post_content: You might try renaming the file to ns3fb-dj

title: RE: NS3 Bundle format
post_content: DJKeys wrote:You might try renaming the file to ns3fb-dj+1 or rename it to .zip, unzip it and then load Programs and Samples separately.

title: RE: NS3 Bundle format
post_content: Thanks guys , am afraid I am computer unsavvy.  Renaming the downloaded .ns3sbundle file does NOT change its properties, merely its name! Would love to be able to unzip it  as I only want to use ONE of its five patches. How do I change its properties to something (.ns3f/.ns3fb) that Sound Manager can recognise? Answers on a postcard please!

title: RE: NS3 Bundle format
post_content: With all respect:If you are “computer unsavvy”, why are you arguing with advice KNOWN AND TESTED to work, rather than trying it?Renaming a Nord bundle to .zip does indeed not change its actual file format, but sincethe thingisa bog-standard zip file with the extension changed to let the Nord Sound Manager know that it contains files the Nord will understand, it really doesn’t need to for you to make it work.

title: RE: NS3 Bundle format
post_content: Hi I wonder if the file is corrupted. What about downloading it aagain and try renamig it as suggested?

title: Patch Creator - PAID

title: RE: Patch Creator - PAID
post_content: Jo Osantos1 wrote:Hello all,I need someone to create a very close sound on the Nord Stage 3. It can be paid! Please PM me.

title: RE: Patch Creator - PAID
post_content: I don't own a Stage 3 (yet), but this sounds like they could have used Lyle Mays's classic lead patch as a starting point, which was an Oberheim Two-Voice (or Four-Voice, depending on who's  telling the story).  For an audio comparison, seek out "The Search", by the Pat Metheny Group, that sound is featured for the first minute or so.I'd try a square wave, maybe mix in a tiny bit of noise, add unison for thickness, experiment with glide (does the synth section allow for glide to be triggered only when playing legato?  The instrument in the video definitely does that, but the S3 manual doesn't say), roll off the highs using the LPF, and add some FX (chorus/verb).  Thatshouldget you in the neighborhood.Having said all that... I'll gladly defer to someone with a real S3 nearby.

title: Octave-layered strings on a single panel
post_content: Hi. I'm a newbie so have mercy...I play in a gig without a bassist, so my panel B synth is always occupied by a bass sample. The thing is, I want a fat octave-layered  strings sound (some phrases are musically problematic with a one-hand octave playing).Any ideas of a quick way achieving this or of an existing sampled octave strings?Thanks in advance,BennyP.S - NS3 76, OS v1.36

title: RE: Octave-layered strings on a single panel
post_content: If you are only using the first 2-3 octaves for the bass, then you can split that panel and add strings on the right side of the split point. From there on you can press the octave down button for the strings on that panel and after you press the store button, the octave setting will be stored as well!

title: RE: Octave-layered strings on a single panel
post_content: Arsenio wrote:If you are only using the first 2-3 octaves for the bass, then you can split that panel and add strings on the right side of the split point. From there on you can press the octave down button for the strings on that panel and after you press the store button, the octave setting will be stored as well!This is false, you can't split the sample engine on same panel.

title: RE: Octave-layered strings on a single panel
post_content: bennyvilner wrote:Hi. I'm a newbie so have mercy...I play in a gig without a bassist, so my panel B synth is always occupied by a bass sample. The thing is, I want a fat octave-layered  strings sound (some phrases are musically problematic with a one-hand octave playing).Any ideas of a quick way achieving this or of an existing sampled octave strings?Thanks in advance,BennyP.S - NS3 76, OS v1.36You need to get sampled octave string sound, some time ago I created the pool so nord would release octave string sound for us, but it seems majority of users don't need it as the pool was voted down.

title: RE: Octave-layered strings on a single panel
post_content: Here’s what I’d do. Have panel A split between bass and strings. Copy the string part and paste it to panel B. Now just octave shift Zone of them up or down and remember to have both panels active.Edit: nvm your bass is a sample aswell. So what I said doesn’t make sense.

title: Stage 3 - Bundle Download
post_content: Hi, I just purchased two bundles for my Stage 3.In the Nord Sound Manager, I'm attempting to download one from my Mac to my Nord.The Nord Sound Manager is looking for all bundle files (*.ns3sbundle), but the files have a *.ns3fb extension.Can these files be imported into my Stage 3, or were they designed for a different Nord keyboard?Thanks,Kirby

title: RE: Stage 3 - Bundle Download
post_content: According to the NSM manual, files ending with "b" are supposed to be backups while bundles end with "pb" or "bundle"; try to copy+rename the files you purchased as .ns3bundle then do a Bundle upload (or as .zip then unzip them, to see what they contain).

title: RE: Stage 3 - Bundle Download
post_content: Yes, that worked. Thanks!

title: RE: Cannot restore Nord Stage 3 Factory Restore RevB
post_content: Factory Restore file for Nord Stage 3 at the bottom of the page will download a zip file called "Nord Stage 3 Factory Restore RevB.zip" which includes all individual library files but no restore file with extension .ns3b which is the only filetype to restore through software manager.What am I doing wrong here?

title: RE: Cannot restore Nord Stage 3 Factory Restore RevB
post_content: Hi everybody - I just figured it outI just renamed the zip file to the extension .ns3bBR

title: NS2 program to NS3 program
post_content: Hello NS 3 owners// Nord technichians.Is there a way to change Nord2 stageprograms in Nordstage 3 programs?just the way we can do now with help of Nord Sample converter 1.12 for samplesPiet Rutges, Netherlands

title: RE: NS2 program to NS3 program
post_content: Hi Piet,I'm afraid there is not.It has been discussed many times on these forums, but the short version is that the machines are sufficiently different that transferring sounds makes little sense.Long version:Having translated a bunch of programs from the Stage 2 to the Stage 3, I can say that even with "identical" settings, they sound markedly different and require enough adjustment that you might as well have just transferred them by hand. The piano filters are simple and very useful and often free up the EQ for assigning to other engines. And the synth section is so different that there is often a much more effective and simpler way to get better-sounding results than on the old machine.Another plus, of course, is that you get to know your machine much better by programming it.Of course, that's fairly easy for me to say, since I only had a few dozen sounds to rebuild. I deeply sympathise with those who have hundreds.

title: Newbie needs Sax help
post_content: I am trying to wrap my head around my new NS3 and am trying to get a good solo sax sound. I have molded a tenor sax sample to get some grit but need a little help. I want the notes to only play one at a time (as a one note synth sound) Just don't know where to go to do this in the synth section. Also if anyone has a dynamite sax sample or program to pass on I sure would appreciate it!! Thank you

title: RE: Newbie needs Sax help
post_content: The technical term for an instrument that plays only one note at a time is “monophonic” (vs. “polyphonic”).There is a “mono” button at the top left of the synth section on the Stage 3.“Legato” mode means that the synth is monophonic, but when you press the next key without releasing the previous one, the sound will glide over to the new note without restarting the whole sound. This is probably the mode you’ll want for a convincing sax.

title: RE: Import new preset synth program from AN1
post_content: thank you,however I do not have an AN1. Since the engine synth is the same, I hope there will be the possibility to import any preset in the future.Today, Where can you find other preset synths for the NS3?thanks

title: RE: Import new preset synth program from AN1
post_content: MarcoCalegher wrote:thank you,however I do not have an AN1. Since the engine synth is the same, I hope there will be the possibility to import any preset in the future.They are not the same. The Stage 3 has no "TB" filter, adding a bandpass filter instead, and the A1 has four sound slots per program, while the Stage 3 only has two.Also, the A1 cannot use samples as a basis for a voice, which the Stage 3 can.The Stage 3 is more of a combination of A1's virtual analog synth AND the Wave's sample-based engine.Transferring programs from either synth doesn't really make sense.

title: RE: Import new preset synth program from AN1
post_content: I am not aware of any sites with downloadable synth presets for the Nord Stage 3 at this time — only the original factory presets.You could make requests in the sounds forum, of course.

title: RE: Is this possible?
post_content: There is no way - absolutely no way - to get a Nord to sound like the complex orchestral patches of the Kronos. Having played a Kronos for a year, those patches - and the RH3 weighted keyboard - were the only things I really liked about the Kronos. The orchestral patches alone are worth the purchase, if you need that.I found the pianos okay, and the electric pianos didn’t touch me at all. Hated the synths and the organ. Absolutely DESPISED the interface. When I had to rebuild the backline after the guy who owned the Kronos dropped out of the project, I opted for Mainstage instead. That doesn’t really kick me in the gut, either, but at least the interface is from Apple, so I’m not hating that, and I’m WAY faster at getting what I need.The Nord is far more limited than Kronos or Mainstage, but I fall in love with the instrument all over again every day.Everything about the Stage 3 inspires me in a way the Kronos never did, and Mainstage doesn’t.

title: Is this possible?
post_content: analogika wrote:The Nord is far more limited than Kronos or Mainstage, but I fall in love with the instrument all over again every day.Everything about the Stage 3 inspires me in a way the Kronos never did, and Mainstage doesn’t.I totally agree!To me, the Nord Stage 3 is like a Moog. It is a musical instrument. It is not intended to be a do-it-all thingamabob. What it does, it does extremely well. The strings and brass are not intended to be 100% realistic. I have 0 doubt that if Nord ever intended to do realistic strings/brass, it could absolutely provide that. But instead, Nord gives us something musical, something inspirational, something tactile and emotional, something we can connect with. Then, if you need more/different, you can supplement with a separate box/board/VST.Watch this... this is how I feel about my Nord...
